required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Lower Abdominal Pain During Office Hysteroscopy Can Assess Tubal Patency in Infertile Women
clinical_study.official_title: Lower Abdominal Pain During Office Hysteroscopy As A Guide In The Assessment Of Tubal Patency In Infertile Women

brief_summary.textblock: Office hysteroscopy through vaginoscopic approach was done in gynecology out-patient clinic with saline distension medium. The presence or absence of lower abdominal pain and the side of pain were recorded. Then, transvaginal sonography within 20 minutes was done to detect the presence of free fluid in the pouch of Douglas. Then, laparoscopy with tubal chromopertubation was done.

detailed_description.textblock: Office hysteroscopy through vaginoscopic approach was done in gynecology out-patient clinic using a 4 mm endoscopic sheath & 30 ᵒ endoscopic camera with saline distension medium using 90-100 mmHg pressure. Meanwhile, the presence or absence of lower abdominal pain and the side of pain were recorded. Then, transvaginal sonography within 20 minutes was done to detect the presence of free fluid in the pouch of Douglas.Then, laparoscopy with tubal chromopertubation was done.

primary_outcome.measure: lower abdominal pain as measured by Visual Analog Scale
primary_outcome.time_frame: at time of hystroscopy till 15 minutes after end of procedure
primary_outcome.description: Pain, as measured by Visual Analog Scale

arm_group.description: women who felt pain at time of office hystroscopy at time of saline infusion and for 15 minutes after end of procedure
women who didn't feel pain at time of office hystroscopy at time of saline infusion and for 15 minutes after end of procedure

intervention.description: Office hysteroscopythrough vaginoscopic approach was done in gynecology out-patient clinic using a 4 mm endoscopic sheath & 30 ᵒ endoscopic camera with saline distension medium using 90-100 mmHg pressure

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Infertile women normal semen analysis
Exclusion Criteria:
- Ladies with evidence of upper or lower genital tract infections,
- presence of free fluid in the pouch of Douglas before hysteroscopy or pelvic pathology or those with cervical stenosis that required cervical dilatation prior to hysteroscopy
